Hilton versus Hilton Garden Inn

Quote:

Originally Posted by Kiwi Flyer

This thread is intended to contain links to other threads and Hilton website information about each Hilton family hotel. This thread does not contain information specific to HHonors or special promo room rates. Currently it is organised geographically.

I hope that this is the proper forum for my question:

What is the difference between a Hilton and a Hilton Garden Inn?

Unfortunatelly, I never stayed in the latter category, and therefore I have no idea what it makes different from a Hilton.

May 16, 2007, 6:59 am

Join Date: Jan 2006

Programs: Cont-Gold, UAL-PremExec, USAir-Silver, HH-Diamond, Marriott Platinum, Starwood-Gold

Posts: 11

hilton vs hgi

Hiltons are full service, usually larger hotels with pools, convenience store, restaurant etc.. they're also substantially more expensive per night. HGI are smaller and they do have an onsite grill with a pretty decent breakfast available for around $10 to $12. They won't have a convenience store and are usually only about 4 stories tall. Also, if you're a hilton diamond, they have upgraded rooms for you at a normal hilton but at an HGI, they only have limited suites and probably won't give those to you.

Originally Posted by Didi

I hope that this is the proper forum for my question:

Unfortunatelly, I never stayed in the latter category, and therefore I have no idea what it makes different from a Hilton.

Hilton Garden Inn Dulles

Opening in Fall 2008 the Hilton Garden Dulles North is located less than 6 miles from Dulles Airport. HHonors program is in place. Reservations are not available but should be within weeks. Please visit site:
